qas.question: Name the three artists who were in part resonsible for the reemergence of Cubism between 1917 and 1924.
Name the three writers who were in part resonsible for the reemergence of Cubism between 1917 and 1924.

answers.text: Pierre Reverdy, Maurice Raynal and Daniel-Henry Kahnweiler

qas.question: In 1918 which way did the French idealogies shift that effected Cubism?
Name the four artists who were in part resonsible for the reemergence of Cubism between 1917 and 1924.
In 1919 which way did the French idealogies shift that effected Cubism?

plausible_answers.text: seen as part of a wide ideological shift towards conservatism

context: The reemergence of Cubism coincided with the appearance from about 1917–24 of a coherent body of theoretical writing by <a1_0>Pierre Reverdy, Maurice Raynal and Daniel-Henry Kahnweiler<a1_0/> and, among the artists, by <a0_0><b3_0>Gris, Léger and Gleizes<b3_0/><a0_0/>. The occasional return to classicism—figurative work either exclusively or alongside Cubist work—experienced by many artists during this period (called Neoclassicism) has been linked to the tendency to evade the realities of the war and also to the cultural dominance of a classical or Latin image of France during and immediately following the war. Cubism after 1918 can be <b6_0>seen as part of a wide ideological shift towards <a2_0><b4_0>conservatism<b6_0/><b4_0/><a2_0/> in both French society and culture. Yet, <b5_0>Cubism<b5_0/> itself remained evolutionary both within the oeuvre of individual artists, such as Gris and Metzinger, and across the work of artists as different from each other as Braque, Léger and Gleizes. Cubism as a publicly debated movement became relatively unified and open to definition. Its theoretical purity made it a gauge against which such diverse tendencies as Realism or Naturalism, Dada, Surrealism and abstraction could be compared.
